lead_paragraph: After the intensity of the Rose and Sugar bowls, it's nice to wake up Saturday with the International Bowl, which pits two second-tier teams from the Big East and Mid-American Conference. If it's bowl season, we all know where to find South Florida: in a tailspin. Yet again, the Bulls have folded in the second half of the season; after starting 5-0 this fall, U.S.F. has dropped five of seven. This is officially a trend. For Northern Illinois, 2009 served as proof that last season's bowl trip -- which came on the heels of a 2-10 finish in 2007 -- was not a fluke. The Huskies have already made a one-win improvement over last season and have a shot at winning eight games for the first time since 2004.
snippet: South Florida experienced a late-season tailspin, while Northern Illinois is going to consecutive bowl games for the first time.

headline.main: International Bowl: South Florida (7-5) vs. Northern Illinois (7-5)

abstract: South Florida experienced a late-season tailspin, while Northern Illinois is going to consecutive bowl games for the first time.
